intro: Dichrocephala alpina, commonly known as the alpine dichrocephala, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, dry conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh climates. Dichrocephala alpina produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
